channel.title: Technology on Technology with Safi
channel.description: Recent content in Technology on Technology with Safi

item.title: A Brief History of Unix
item.description: Today Unix-like operating systems chiefly Linux dominates both the server market and the mobile market. The history of Unix is old and is full of twists.

item.title: My top 5 favorite Free and Open Source Video Games
item.description: This is the list of my top 5 most favorite Free and Open Source Video Games

item.title: What is the Purpose of Union Data Type in C Language
item.description: At first glance union and struct data types in C language look the same and it seems like the union is useless but they are different and the union has a purpose.

item.title: How to change Console Fonts in Linux
item.description: I always wondered how to change the console VGA fonts outside of X in Linux. I finally figured it out.

item.title: How to Install Wine on Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye 64-bit
item.description: Installing Wine and running classic Windows games on Raspberry Pi 64-bit is a bit tricky but it can be done through my guide easily.

item.title: How to Install Box86 and Box64 on Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye 64-bit
item.description: Box86 and Box64 are great x86 and x86_64 compatibility layers for ARM-based SBCs including Raspberry Pi. I will guide you on how to install them both at the same time on Raspberry Pi OS bullseye 64-bit.

item.title: Virtualization in old x86 CPUs
item.description: We all know that modern x86 CPUs can do hardware virtualization but do you know a form of virtualization has existed in all x86 CPUs since the 1980s?

item.title: How to turn your older Raspberry Pi into a BitTorrent Home Media Sever
item.description: How to turn your Raspberry Pi 0/1 into a BitTorrent Client Home Media Server with qBittorrent and MiniDLNA(Now ReadyMedia).

item.title: One of my favorite FOSS game Scorched 3D
item.description: Scorched 3D is a turn-based 3D artillery game inspired by the old MS-DOS title of Scorched Earth. The game is an extremely addictive game.

item.title: How to run SuperTuxKart properly on your Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye
item.description: How to run SuperTux Kart properly without the missing graphics on Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye (64-bit) running on Raspberry Pi 4 and Raspberry Pi 400.

item.title: How to control the keyboard and mouse of your compute remotely via SSH
item.description: How to control the keyboard and mouse of your Linux machine remotely via x2x and SSH

item.title: How to make Raspberry Pi OS Bullseye more useful
item.description: Raspberry Pi OS is great for beginners but it is rather limited as a desktop OS. I will explain how to turn it into a more standard Linux distro.
